holidays.name: International Talk Like a Pirate Day
holidays.description: A playful celebration encouraging people worldwide to talk like pirates, using phrases like 'Ahoy!' and 'Avast!' to bring out their inner buccaneer.
holidays.origin: Created in 1995 by friends John Baur and Mark Summers as a fun inside joke, which then went viral and became an internationally recognized quirky holiday.
holidays.funFact: This holiday inspired pirate-themed events in bars, schools, and even software updates that add pirate speak!

holidays.name: National Pepperoni Pizza Day
holidays.description: A delicious tribute to the most popular pizza topping‚Äîpepperoni! Perfect excuse to enjoy a cheesy, spicy slice (or three).
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday celebrated by pizza lovers to honor their favorite topping, with no specific founding date but gaining traction in food communities.
holidays.funFact: Pepperoni is the most requested pizza topping in the United States, edging out mushrooms and sausage.

holidays.name: National Hunting and Fishing Day (USA)
holidays.description: A day dedicated to appreciating and promoting ethical hunting and fishing activities and outdoor sportsmanship.
holidays.origin: Established by the United States Congress in 1972 to recognize the contributions of hunters and fishermen to wildlife conservation.
holidays.funFact: Hunters and anglers contribute billions to wildlife and habitat conservation efforts annually through license fees and taxes.

holidays.name: Coombe Fish Festival (Cornwall, UK)
holidays.description: A quirky, fish-themed local festival in a small Cornish village celebrating fishing traditions with games and seafood tastings.
holidays.origin: Centuries-old village festival rooted in fishing culture, evolving into a quirky community event each September.
holidays.funFact: Some festival games include 'wet fish throwing' contests to see who can toss fresh fish the farthest!
